title-group.article-title: Design, Evaluation, and Selection Of Heavy-Duty Rear Axles

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1955, Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: HEAVY-DUTY rear axles are analyzed in this paper â€“ the first L. Ray Buckendale Lecture to be delivered. The author presents a practical method of evaluating heavy-duty rear axles, with emphasis on performance and axle ratio. The major part of the paper is devoted to a discussion of the four functions of rear axles, as follows: (1) To carry the load, (2) to transmit driving torque, (3) to allow differential action, and (4) to help stop the vehicle.
